page.title: 06Sudbury's Silk Industry
page.content: The silk industry in Sudbury dates back to the eighteenth century and still flourishes today. The cottages of the weavers of two hundred years ago can still be seen but today silk workers no longer live and work in them. There are three mills in the town today and each one participates in a different part of the manufacturing process. STEPHEN WALTERS-This factory produces silk from its raw state, dyes it and makes material to be finished into garments. VANNERS-Specialises in motifs and patterns for silk ties. These ties cost around fifty two pounds in the shops. GAINSBOROUGH SILKS-This mill makes fine silk and produced the material used for the wedding dresses of HRH Princess Anne and HRH the Princess of Wales. BY JOANNE MOORE AND ZOE WHEATLEY.
